title: Small-Sided Games Design Workshop for Soccer Tactical Training

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic soccer rules and techniques, and team sports experience
context.additional_context: Learners acquire methods for designing training that reflects real-game environments, with emphasis on developing tactical adaptability across varying pitch sizes. Learning effectiveness is evaluated through real-time data analysis using digital devices.

learning_goals: They are evaluated on their ability to apply offensive/defensive tactical principles based on pitch size (small, medium, large).
They explain game design methods to optimize spatial utilization (width and depth) within a team.
They can develop tactical training tasks tailored to skill levels (beginner vs. intermediate).

resources: Soccer Balls, Cones, GPS Trackers, or Wearable Devices

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
